strings: <se_low>Yangus: Who'd 'ave thought we'd end up in a place like this just by touchin' a mirror!?

<se_low>Yangus: Rich people 'ave the money to buy some pretty weird stuff, don't they?
I wonder what this place is anyway.
<se_low>Yangus: Did you 'ear that!? That's the Chancellor of Argonia they've got there!

<se_low>Yangus: Think o' the reward we'd get if we saved 'im!
...Or am I jumpin' the gun?

<se_low>Yangus: Huh.
I didn't expect no boss troll to beat us so easy!
<se_low>Yangus: I say we stop messin' about, psyche ourselves up and give 'em the beatin' they deserve!
<se_low>Yangus: Fancy them 'avin' to survive on seeds of strength while they was cooped up like that!
<se_low>Yangus: They'd 'ave probably got strong enough to break their own way out if we 'adn't shown up first!

<se_high>Jessica: When I heard the mirror was the entrance,
I expected it to lead somewhere beautiful.
Not this dingy-looking place.
<se_high>Jessica: But there's no point complaining about it now that we're here. Let's walk around and see what we can find.
<se_high>Jessica: So did the boss trolls come through the mirror and kidnap the Chancellor?
<se_high>Jessica: Or did the Chancellor go into the mirror himself and get captured?
<se_high>Jessica: We'd better hurry and get the Chancellor before dinnertime rolls around for those boss trolls!
<se_high>Jessica: I feel sorry for the Chancellor and his family.

<se_high>Jessica: I mean, who would expect the mirror in their bedroom to lead to a boss troll's den?
It's totally crazy!
<se_def>Angelo: This is probably what happened to the Chancellor and his wife. I bet they ended up in here as well.

<se_def>Angelo: Those guys are pretty civilised for monsters, cooking their food before they eat it!
I'm impressed.
<se_def>Angelo: I'm not so taken with their choice of ingredients, though...and I don't hold out much hope for their table manners either, if I'm honest.

<se_def>Angelo: This is no good! We can't just stand around chatting like we've got all the time in the world!<page>Angelo: The Chancellor's about to become intimately acquainted with the inner workings of a troll's digestive system!
<se_def>Angelo: This can't be right! A couple of boss trolls shouldn't be able to get the better of us!

<se_def>Angelo: Never mind about saving them!
We have to win this time to save our own pride!
<se_def>Angelo: Well, that's them polished off. I don't suppose they'll be back for seconds. In fact, we may have put them off dinner parties for life!
<se_def>Angelo: When I think of all the people they've probably made a meal of, all those tender young maids... It makes me wish I'd known about this sooner.

<se_high>Red: Wot's the deal wiv that mirror then, eh?
...I just don't get 'ow magic stuff like that works.

<se_high>Red: We've been transported or somefin', 'ave we?
Miles away from where we started off?
Or are we actually like, inside the mirror now?
<se_high>Red: Come on, <hero>, this ain't no time for a chat. We've gotta rescue that Chancellor.
<se_high>Red: You do know who 'e is, don't ya? A proper bigwig, that's who. We'll be up for a whoppin' great reward if we save the day now!
<se_high>Red: I let me concentration slip. I was too busy thinkin' about that juicy reward that'll be waitin' for us.
<se_high>Red: Some magic that is, eh? Leadin' us into an 'ornets' nest like this!
<se_high>Red: Where'd the Chancellor even get 'old of a mirror like this anyway, that's wot I wanna know.

<se_low>Morrie: (Sniff, sniff) Can you smell it, too?
It is the smell of the most expensive monster food I have in my pit.

<se_low>Morrie: Ah, so this smell I smell before was the three-course meal of the monsters, ay?
But they are still having the soup starter.
<se_low>Morrie: We must stop them before they have the Chancellor main course! Then I give them some other recipe ideas. Something more tasty than the humans...and maybe not so much fat, ay?
<se_low>Morrie: Hmph! They ignore the cooking advice of Morrie Mozzarella!?
<se_low>Morrie: This, this hurts me very much. Maybe more than being boiled in a pot of hot water, ay?

<se_low>Morrie: It is a lucky day, ay?
We manage to divert the culinary disaster!
